intro: Thapsia villosa var. microcarpa, commonly known as the woolly thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers in umbel-like clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
